data.title: Jay Leno files for conservatorship for his wife Mavis, who is battling dementia
data.meta_description: Jay Leno has reportedly filed for conservatorship for his wife, Mavis, who he said has been diagnosed with dementia.
data.text:
Comedian and former host of "The Tonight Show" Jay Leno has reportedly filed for conservatorship for his wife, Mavis, who he said has been diagnosed with dementia.

Leno on Friday filed legal documents "to set up a living trust for Mavis to ensure that she has 'managed assets' to provide her with future care if he died," according to .

The news comes a year after -- including a broken collarbone, two busted ribs, and two cracked kneecaps -- in what he described as a motorcycle crash.

Leno previously told the Las Vegas Review-Journal's John Katsilometes it happened on Jan. 17, 2023. He said he was testing out a 1940 motorcycle and noticed the scent of leaking gas.

At the time, he said someone had strung a wire across a parking lot, but there wasn't a flag or warning sign.
